com.rshepard.atm

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rshepard.atm.Account

  • public class Account
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates a virtual bank account with the typical information. This class uses a static int for the account number so that every time an account is created it assigns a unique number for each account by incrementing the the account pool every time the constructor is called.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Account()
      Default constructor: Creates a single account, sets all values to zero, assigns a unique account number, and increments the account pool by one.
      Account(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, double checkingBalance, double savingsBalance)
      Creates a single bank account to be used in the validation class and sets all the proper information relating to the bank account.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Account

        public Account()
        Default constructor: Creates a single account, sets all values to zero, assigns a unique account number, and increments the account pool by one.

      • Account

        public Account(java.lang.String firstName,
               java.lang.String lastName,
               double checkingBalance,
               double savingsBalance)
        Creates a single bank account to be used in the validation class and sets all the proper information relating to the bank account. Also assigns a unique account number and increments the account pool by one.
        Parameters:
        firstName - Sets the first name on the account
        lastName - Sets the last name on the account
        checkingBalance - Initializes the beginning checking account balance on the account
        savingsBalance - Initializes the beginning savings balance on the account
